Name: Minimum Remove to Make Valid Parentheses
Answer: Stack - keep track of unmatching )'s index and print

Name: Binary Tree Vertical Order Traversal
Answer: BFS with col n print. DFS to give col, row numbers, heapq (col, row, val), map to group them by col + print.

Name: Lowest Common Ancestor of a Binary Tree III [Parent]
Answer: Variation, if parent is None, flip it to other head

Name: Intersection of Two Linked Lists
Answer: a+c+b = b+c+a

Name: Lowest Common Ancestor of a Binary Tree II [p/q might not exist]
Answer: If p/q exist return none or p or q. If it doesn't exisit -> recursive call and then check node is p or q. Record p/q isFound. Becauze if p is found it returns and q won't reach if its the subtree of p

Name: Buildings With an Ocean View
Answer: Go right to left. Track max

Name: Basic Calculator II
Answer: Track prev_int, prev_opt, curr_int. Accumulate */, prev_opt +-. Append + to s for easy for loop

Name: Nested List Weight Sum
Answer: BFS store depth n calc weighted sum - simple

Name: Random Pick with Weight
Answer: Store prefix sum - sorted array, binary search rand+totalsum

Name: Dot Product of Two Sparse Vectors
Answer: Store non zero indices of 2 arrays, 2 ptr n multiple matching indices

Name: Pow(x, n)
Answer: Binary exponent, use iteration x=1/x n=-1*n for -n. 2^15 -> 2.(4.4)^7. while n//2 != 0

Name: Simplify Path: Unix-style file system
Answer: Split by /, rev, skip++ for .., if legit skip-- or add. Note: trailing /

Name: Kth Largest Element in an Array
Answer: Counting sort too! Bounder heapq like topk. Quick select will give better avg complixity for higher worst case. By choosing pivot using median of median algo, worst case will come down to n. Probability (2^n/n!) - each iter gets exponentially low. Just make sure its not the largest or smallest element.
Complexity: nlogk, n, n^2, m. Space k, 1, m

Name: Lowest Common Ancestor of a Binary Tree [Simple]
Answer: return node if None or p or q. l and r => n else l or r.

Name: Custom Sort String
Answer: Counting sort. Simplify. Map of counter(s), order[c] * count(c) -> result. Del count(c) from dict to not re-add

Name: Minimum Add to Make Parentheses Valid
Answer: Easy just use a counter to track ( and match it with ), if openCounter < 1, minRequired++. Use counter since only one type of bracket, else use stack

Name: Shortest Path in Binary Matrix
Answer: BFS - Lattice Graph - A* for bonus. Queue (r,c,dist)

Name: Merge Intervals
Answer: Elegant technique to handle -1 index. sort n merge

Name: Sum Root to Leaf Numbers
Answer: Global var for result. Preorder(node, num=0), when node is None, res += num

Name: Find Peak Element
Answer: Binary search - see sol. if mid > mid+1 (peak) : r=mid else l=mid+1. mid and mid+1 are the candidates

Name: Binary Tree Right Side View
Answer: Queue (node + depth), print only right for each depth. if len(res) is depth actually

Name: K Closest Points to Origin [R-Quick select]
Answer: Topk, quickselect => swap instead of partition. Beautiful - read comments

Name: Group Shifted Strings
Answer: Group string with same char offsets (use modulo). (1, 1): ['abc', 'bcd', 'xyz']

Name: Convert Binary Search Tree to Sorted Doubly Linked List
Answer: Have a global var to track prev node, store the next bst node in that and move the ptr

Name: Continuous Subarray Sum (sub is a multiple of 2)
Answer: Mathemetricall (R1 - R2) is divisible by k then yes. prefixSum[i] % k == prefixSum[j] % k then return True. Store prefixSum % k,index in hashmap

Name: Subarray Sum Equals K
Answer: Store count of same prefix. if diff in dict, count += val

Name: Insert into a Sorted Circular Linked List
Answer: prev, curr pointer. Track head and tail and insert at the end if can't insert in middle. 3 cases (mid, end, uniform values)

Name: Next Permutation
Answer: Find first peak from right. Swap p-1 with slightly higher right to peak, reverse p to end. No way!
